attributes.action: Local Secondary Schools for Claygate Children.
attributes.background: KIDS NOT COMMUTERS  Children living in Claygate have yet again been allocated out of borough secondary school places, requiring a daily 3 hr return commute, navigating several changes on some of the busiest and congested routes in the area, despite living in catchment to two local schools

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Allocation of school places is the responsibility of your local educational authority (usually your local council).

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use the following page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Your local council may also have a petitions process. You should be able to find details of this on its website.
